channel.title: www.telegraph.co.uk for the latest news from the UK and around the world.
channel.description: www.telegraph.co.uk for the latest news from the UK and around the world.

item.title: House prices surge to record high
item.dc:creator: Chris Price
Szu Ping Chan
item.description: House prices rose to a new record high last month amid rising demand for mortgages and easing borrowing costs, according to a lender.

item.title: Spurs manager ‘Poste-no-clue’ in bust-up with fans after Bournemouth defeat
item.dc:creator: Will Conroy
item.description: Ange Postecoglou was involved in an angry exchange with Tottenham Hotspur supporters after a 1-0 defeat at Bournemouth during which the travelling fans abused the manager and called him ‘Poste-no-clue’.

item.title: Watch: How to wrap awkwardly-shaped presents, from bottles to tins
item.dc:creator: Jessica Doyle
item.description: Whether it’s a standard box or an awkward shape, follow these step-by-step instructions to create the perfect package

item.title: Harry Brook century scorches New Zealand as England take control in second Test
item.dc:creator: Kieran Crichard
Nick Hoult
item.description: There cannot be many more successful British exports at the moment than Harry Brook. His seventh hundred away from home highlighted the best of Bazball, and it was an innings that held his team together.

item.title: ‘My life changed in a second – from training to become an Army officer to being a wheelchair user’
item.dc:creator: Emily Retter
item.description: Ollie Thorn, a former professional para snowsports star, explains why rehabilitation and inclusion matter

item.title: What’s on TV tonight: Lena Zavaroni: The Forgotten Child Star, The Sticky, and more
item.dc:creator: Telegraph reporters
item.description: Your complete guide to the week’s television, films and sport, across terrestrial and digital platforms

item.title: South Korea’s president set to be impeached after key ally U-turns and calls him threat to public
item.dc:creator: Our Foreign Staff
item.description: Han Dong-hoon says there is ‘credible evidence’ President Yoon tried to have politicians arrested

item.title: Fifa Club World Cup: When it starts, the draw and how to watch in the UK
item.dc:creator: Tom Morgan
item.description: The tournament is Fifa’s pet project – an attempt to secure a slice of international TV broadcast revenue

item.title: Rachel Reeves ‘will launch second National Insurance raid’
item.dc:creator: James Titcomb
Matthew Field
Alex Singleton
Eir Nolsoe
item.description: Rachel Reeves will hit employers with a second National Insurance tax raid as soon as next autumn, economists have warned.

item.title: A guide to ski holidays in Megève, France’s most famous medieval resort
item.dc:creator: Telegraph Ski & Snowboard
item.description: The best places to stay, eat, drink and ski in the most beautiful resort in France, fit for Emily in Paris and royalty alike

item.title: Best cat toys for play, exercise, and mental stimulation
item.dc:creator: Lucy Tobin
item.description: Cats are notoriously fussy, so our team of felines worked hard to put the best cat toys through their paces

item.title: UK may be unable to produce enough vaccines in next pandemic, government told
item.dc:creator: Arthur Scott-Geddes
item.description: Britain is falling behind other countries that are better prepared for future threats, Baroness Brown has warned

item.title: Experts scrambled as mystery outbreak kills 79 in remote part of the Congo
item.dc:creator: Maeve Cullinan
item.description: Specialists rule out coronavirus but say that the disease affects the respiratory system, with symptoms particularly acute in young people

item.title: Mermade AirCurl review: can this Barbie-pink gadget give your hair the look it deserves?
item.dc:creator: Bethan King
item.description: We test Mermade’s new hair tool to see if it delivers big, bouncy curls

item.title: The best mini fridges for chilling food and drinks or storing your skincare products
item.dc:creator: Bess Browing
item.description: We’ve tested the best mini fridges on the market, covering every size, design and budget and asked the experts to choose their favourites

item.title: The 10 best electric blankets and throws in 2024, to keep you warm on cold nights
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Astill
Tomé Morrissy Swan
item.description: The Telegraph's sleep experts review the best electric blankets and throws to keep your bed cosy this winter (and cut down on heating bills)

item.title: ‘Breakbone fever’ being spread through contaminated blood supplies in South America, warn doctors
item.dc:creator: Sarah Newey
item.description: Dengue and other arborviruses including Zika can be spread through donor blood which is not screened with fatal results

item.title: The best sports bras to support you during running, yoga and gym workouts
item.dc:creator: Alice Porter
item.description: Can’t find the best sports bra for your shape or fitness routine? We’ve tried all your favourite brands, so you don’t have to...

item.title: Starmer’s ‘milestones’ fail to tackle immigration, defence or benefits
item.dc:creator: Ben Riley-Smith
Jack Maidment
item.description: Sir Keir Starmer has unveiled his blueprint for the next five years – without any new promises on defence spending, reducing immigration or moving people off welfare and into work.

item.title: Measles ‘patient zero’ came from London – but it was Birmingham that took the hit
item.dc:creator: Maeve Cullinan
item.description: A family of four who visited the West Midlands unwittingly triggered one of the most severe measles outbreaks in Britain for almost a decade

item.title: Women’s Euro 2025: Everything you need to know
item.dc:creator: Fiona Tomas
Rosina Butcher
Jessica Hopkins
item.description: England have secured their spot at Euro 2025 and will attempt to defend their crown in Switzerland next summer. Wales have also qualified

item.title: Christmas traditions that are cancelled – and what to do instead
item.dc:creator: Boudicca Fox-Leonard
item.description: These rituals have defined the festive period for generations, but are now under threat. Here are the modern ways to celebrate this December

item.title: The best standing desks for working at home, tried and tested – do they really relieve back pain?
item.dc:creator: Kulwinder Rai
item.description: We tried a dozen of the best standing desks, also known as rising desks or height-adjustable desks, to see which helped most with a bad back

item.title: The best mattress toppers of 2024 for a more comfortable sleep, including for side sleepers
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Astill
item.description: The best mattress toppers add a layer of support and comfort, bringing you better sleep for a fraction of the cost of a whole new mattress

item.title: Marcato Atlas 150 Pasta Machine review: is this the key to making authentic Italian cuisine?
item.dc:creator: Libby Galvin
item.description: Fancy homemade lasagna, fettuccine or tagliolini? We tried and tested them all with the classic, 1960s-designed Marcato Atlas pasta machine

item.title: Telegraph Fantasy Football tips: Game Week 14
item.dc:creator: Fantasy Football Hub
item.description: You need to look more than one fixture ahead, especially during the festive period, and these three exert tips offer points and longevity

item.title: How to save a million lives a year – make the new obesity drugs available to the developing world
item.dc:creator: Peter Singer
item.description: The benefits of GLP-1 inhibitors are so far largely limited to wealthy nations. Expanding global access could bring transformative effects

item.title: ‘My hamstring injury turned out to be cancer – I needed five brain surgeries’
item.dc:creator: Taylor O’Farrell
item.description: I had everything to live for and never really thought about illness until I was diagnosed last year, aged 21

item.title: Two boys in critical condition after California school shooting
item.dc:creator: Our Foreign Staff
item.description: Gunman found dead near school playground

item.title: Arsenal’s deadly corner routines prove too much for Manchester United
item.dc:creator: Rob Bagchi
Sam Dean
item.description: Never in the history of football has a team been such a threat from corners. It is hard to recall danger being created so often. Being created from every sniper-accurate delivery, in fact.

item.title: Liverpool drop valuable points in end-to-end classic against Newcastle
item.dc:creator: Kieran Crichard
item.description: This was such a classic that even the great Mohamed Salah, in what might be the finest farewell lap in any Premier League career, could not quite bend the evening to his iron will – although it would be fair to say he made a very good attempt.

item.title: Morgan Rogers brilliance breathes life into Aston Villa
item.dc:creator: Andy McGrath
item.description: It turns out the magic potion needed to end Aston Villa’s miserable run came in a bottle of peroxide applied to Morgan Rogers’s hair.

item.title: Biden was wrong to shun Musk, says Bill Clinton
item.dc:creator: James Titcomb
Alex Singleton
item.description: US president Joe Biden made a mistake in not embracing Elon Musk, his predecessor Bill Clinton has said, after the Tesla boss donated millions to Donald Trump’s presidential campaign.

item.title: The best bread makers for fresh loaves at home, tried and tested
item.dc:creator: Tomé Morrissy Swan

item.description: From artisan to your simple loaf, you won’t eat fresher bread if you have one of these in your home

item.title: Ask Richard Madeley: Christmas Q&A
item.dc:creator: Richard Madeley

Lorna Perry
item.description: The Telegraph’s agony uncle, Richard Madeley, was on hand to offer his suggestions to readers’ festive dilemmas on Wednesday, December 4.

item.title: 39 of the best Christmas gifts for men, including last minute present ideas from under £20
item.dc:creator: Simon Lewis
item.description: Christmas gifts for men are hard to choose, but don’t despair: here are this year’s 39 best gift ideas for him, from £15 to “way too much”

item.title: Starmer won’t repeat pledge to make UK economy fastest growing in G7
item.dc:creator: Jack Maidment
item.description: Sir Keir Starmer refused to repeat his manifesto pledge to make the UK economy the fastest growing in the G7.

item.title: How to spend a vibrant weekend in Melbourne
item.dc:creator: Donna Wheeler
item.description: From the beach to the bar, discover the best of the city with our insider guide to 48 hours in Australia's hipster hub

item.title: Marlborough racing tips and best bets for today’s races
item.dc:creator: Marlborough
item.description: Welcome to our racing tips and best bets service provided by Telegraph Sport’s champion tipster – updated here every day

item.title: Watch: Lucy Bronze blocked from coming on because England forgot to register her
item.dc:creator: Joel Mians
item.description: England manager Sarina Wiegman admitted she was left frustrated by a “human error” that prevented Lucy Bronze from coming off the bench against Switzerland on Tuesday night.

item.title: Too many presents can wreck Christmas – here’s what I’m doing instead
item.dc:creator: Maggie Alderson
item.description: Avoid wasting half the day unwrapping things you don’t need and spend it having fun instead

item.title: The 10 best IPL hair removal devices for smooth, hairless skin, tried and tested
item.dc:creator: Maisie Bovingdon
item.description: Wanting to avoid rashes and torturous beauty regimes? These tech-savvy alternatives could be the answer

item.title: The best 4K TVs of 2024, tried and tested with expert advice on how to choose
item.dc:creator: Simon Lewis
item.description: Hisense, Samsung or Sony? 55-inch or 65? QLED or ULED? Don't upgrade your television until you've read our guide to this year's best 4K TVs

item.title: ‘My screams went unheard’: Women and girls suffer in Kenya’s worst drought in 40 years
item.dc:creator: Tom Parry
item.description: Climate change isn’t only normalising acute malnutrition – it is exposing drought migrants to increased sexual violence and child marriage

item.title: ‘You can’t shake the threat out of your head’: How one ex-soldier fought crippling PTSD
item.dc:creator: Jack Rear
item.description: After serving in the Army in Belfast during the Troubles, John Cutting struggled to adapt to civilian life – until he found solace in art

item.title: Jamie Vardy gives Ruud van Nistelrooy lift-off as Leicester down West Ham
item.dc:creator: Andy McGrath
item.description: It was just over nine years ago when Jamie Vardy broke Ruud van Nistelrooy’s goalscoring record, so it was perhaps inevitable that Leicester’s greatest ever signing would kick off this new era.

item.title: Italy’s deputy prime minister blames billionaire heir for Vauxhall owner crisis
item.dc:creator: Chris Price
Alex Singleton
Christopher Jasper
item.description: Italy’s deputy prime minister has hit out at Vauxhall parent Stellantis, saying its problems are as much the fault of billionaire investors the Agnelli family as its ousted boss Carlos Tavares.

item.dc:creator: Maeve Cullinan
item.description: The jabs are being stockpiled in case H5N1 adapts to spread between humans

item.title: Scott Mitchell: ‘I always said I’d never let Barbara go to a care home. I had this terrible guilt’
item.dc:creator: Jack Rear
item.description: Barbara Windsor’s widower represents Alzheimer’s Research UK, which will benefit from this year’s Telegraph Christmas Charity Appeal

item.title: Gary Neville aims dig at Pep Guardiola after FA Cup third round draw pits Salford against Man City
item.dc:creator: Uche Amako
item.description: Salford City co-owner Gary Neville aimed a cheeky dig at Pep Guardiola after the League Two side were drawn away to Manchester City in the third round of the FA Cup.

item.title: Watch: Dozens of Assad soldiers surrender to rebels

Daniel Hardaker
item.description: Dozens of Syrian government troops have been filmed surrendering to rebels after they were abandoned by their comrades at a town south of Aleppo.

item.title: Housebuilders suffer £500m slump over Budget and cladding fears
item.dc:creator: Chris Price
Alex Singleton
Pui-Guan Man
item.description: Nearly half a billion pounds has been wiped off the value of Britain’s biggest housebuilders amid fears over a combined hit from Budget tax rises and a government cladding clampdown.

item.title: Christmas recipe Q&A: Do you have a question for Diana Henry?
item.dc:creator: Diana Henry
item.description: The Telegraph’s award-winning cookery writer, Diana Henry, will be on hand to answer your Christmas cooking dilemmas on Tuesday December 10 from 6pm to 7.30pm.

item.title: Readers Submission Privacy Notice
item.description: Telegraph Media Group Holdings Limited ("The Telegraph") is the data controller of your personal data. This means that the Telegraph decides what your personal data is used for, and the ways in which it is processed. As the data controller, the Telegraph has the responsibility to comply, and to demonstrate compliance with, data protection law.

item.description: Introduction

item.title: Grow your own genetically modified mosquito colony – just add water
item.dc:creator: Maeve Cullinan
Constance Malleret
item.description: As conventional methods to control mosquito populations become less effective, a controversial experiment yields promising results

item.title: Lando Norris apologises for ‘f------ up’ Qatar GP as McLaren hit out at FIA penalty
item.dc:creator: Luke Slater
item.description: An ugly bust-up between Qatar Grand Prix winner Max Verstappen and Mercedes’ George Russell; Lando Norris apologising for “f-----g up” the race; McLaren hitting out at the FIA for what they perceived to be a “disproportionate penalty” for their driver; yet more misery for Lewis Hamilton; multiple crashes; three safety cars; two punctures, both potentially caused by debris from a wing mirror which was bizarrely left on the track following an earlier collision. All that was missing was a partridge in a pear tree. December 1 certainly delivered on the Formula One front.

item.title: Ruben Amorim seals first Premier League win as Manchester United thrash Everton
item.dc:creator: Luke Slater
Uche Amako
item.description: Marcus Rashford’s future was questioned when he jetted to America during Ruben Amorim’s first days in charge at Manchester United. Yet in his first matches under the new head coach, with three goals in two games, Rashford looks in it for the long haul.

item.title: Slot has fused heavy-metal football with Dutch control – Liverpool look uncatchable
item.dc:creator: Rob Bagchi
Jason Burt
item.description: For 20 minutes Liverpool played good old-fashioned Jürgen Klopp football as they tore into Manchester City. It was rock and roll. Heavy metal. Full throttle. Peak Klopp. And City could not cope.

item.title: Assad vows to ‘break’ rebel offensive in Syria
item.dc:creator: Daniel Hardaker
Harriet Barber
Fared Al Mahlool
item.description: Syrian president Bashar al-Assad vowed to crush a rebel uprising that swept the north east of his country and took control of the second city of Aleppo.

item.title: Ange Postecoglou: Spurs win over Manchester City has become a millstone
item.dc:creator: Jim White
item.description: After their heroics last week at the Etihad, Tottenham were outplayed by Fulham, who claimed a well-earned point

item.description: American Olympic skiing star said she was not badly injured in the incident during a race in Vermont

item.description: The Who frontman talks about turning 80, politics and his passionate work for the Teenage Cancer Trust

item.dc:creator: Kieran Crichard
Nick Hoult
item.description: Brydon Carse spent most of last summer confined to watching cricket on television and mulling over the advice he received from Ben Stokes about how to handle his gambling ban.

item.title: ‘I’ve still got it,’ insists Lewis Hamilton despite being outshone by George Russell again
item.dc:creator: Luke Slater
item.description: A defiant Lewis Hamilton said he was convinced he “still had it”, adding his pace at the age of 39 was not even “a question in his mind” after qualifying sixth on the grid for Sunday’s Qatar Grand Prix.

item.title: Lionesses shore up defence but have questions to answer in attack
item.dc:creator: Rob Smyth
item.description: In a game that had promised excitement and fireworks, the biggest celebration came from one of the goalkeepers.

item.title: Exhilarating Arsenal best-placed to challenge Liverpool after thumping win
item.dc:creator: Rob Bagchi
Sam Wallace
Matt Law
item.description: Mikel Arteta’s players crammed two games-worth of goals into little more than half an hour, returning Arsenal to second place and the position of the Premier League’s official challengers one day before the big one at Anfield.

item.title: Gloucester gain revenge for 90-0 mauling as Santiago Carreras stars in win over Northampton
item.dc:creator: Telegraph Sport
item.description: Saints’ title defence takes another hit with their first home league defeat since October last year

item.title: Eddie Howe has hit a ceiling at Newcastle
item.dc:creator: Ian McCullough
item.description: Late equaliser by Crystal Palace, an injury to Alexander Isak and another toothless display in attack leaves manager under pressure

item.title: Watch: Wolves goalkeeper Jose Sa clashes with fan in ugly scenes during Bournemouth defeat
item.dc:creator: Andy McGrath
item.description: Wolves goalkeeper José Sá had to be held back by match-day stewards after confronting an angry fan in the stands as the club’s recent revival was brought to an abrupt halt by Bournemouth.

item.dc:creator: Telegraph Sport

item.title: Christmas morning buns

item.description: These tempting treats are to be a family favourite on Christmas and Boxing day

item.title: Chris Woakes proves he can perform away from home as England seize control of first Test
item.dc:creator: Kieran Crichard
item.description: A combination of joy and relief poured out of Chris Woakes as he celebrated two wickets in two balls that cracked open the New Zealand innings and tempered talk of this being his last Test away from home.

item.title: Alastair Stewart: I can’t tie my own shoelaces now
item.dc:creator: Louise Carpenter
item.description: British TV’s longest-serving male newsreader explains how his life – and that of his wife – has changed since his dementia diagnosis

item.title: Bristol Bears spoil Joe Marler’s last match and move top of the Premiership
item.dc:creator: Charlie Morgan
item.description: There were fireworks but no fairytale finish as Bristol Bears spoiled the Joe Marler send-off, dismissing Harlequins with a 48-24 win to move top of the Premiership table, until Saturday afternoon at least.

item.title: Lando Norris takes Qatar GP sprint pole ahead of George Russell
item.dc:creator: Luke Slater
item.description: McLaren’s attempt to win their first constructors’ title since 1998 received a boost after Lando Norris took pole for Saturday’s sprint race in Qatar, with team-mate Oscar Piastri third quickest. The two McLaren drivers were split by Mercedes’ George Russell.

item.title: Trump trades send FTSE 100 to best month since summer
item.dc:creator: Chris Price

item.description: The FTSE 100 is on track for its best month since July as so-called Trump trades fuelled a surge in the index.

item.title: Scientists built a great wall to keep out the ‘man devourer’ – but now it’s fighting back
item.dc:creator: Arthur Scott-Geddes
Simeon Tegel
item.description: The new world screw worm, a species of fly that lays its eggs in the open wounds of warm-blooded animals, is making a comeback
